normalised: ## Decoding Rental Yields: Is Your Property a Paisa Vasool Investment?

unnormalised: Hey guys, Rohan here! Ever wondered if that swanky new flat you bought in Bandra is actually pulling its weight? We're talking about rental yields – the unsung heroes of the real estate investment world. Basically, it’s how much moolah your property generates in rent compared to its purchase price.
normalised: Hey guys, Rohan here! Ever wondered if that swanky new flat you bought in Bandra is actually pulling its weight? We're talking about rental yields – the unsung heroes of the real estate investment world. Basically, it’s how much moolah your property generates in rent compared to its purchase price.

unnormalised: Think of it like this: you buy a 2BHK apartment in Powai for Rs. 1.5 Cr. You rent it out for Rs. 40,000 per month (Rs. 4,80,000 annually). Your gross rental yield is (Rs. 4,80,000 / Rs. 1,50,00,000) * 100 = 3.2%. Not bad, right?
normalised: Think of it like this: you buy a two B H K apartment in Powai for rupee one point five crore. You rent it out for rupee forty thousand per month (rupee four lakh eighty thousand annually). Your gross rental yield is (rupee four lakh eighty thousand divided by rupee one crore fifty lakh) asterisk one hundred equals three point two percent. Not bad, right?

unnormalised: But hold up! We need to factor in expenses. Think property taxes (Mumbai charges quite a bit!), maintenance charges to the housing society, maybe even that leaky faucet repair you called Dr. Sharma for. After deducting all that, you get your net rental yield. This is the real deal.
normalised: But hold up! We need to factor in expenses. Think property taxes (Mumbai charges quite a bit!), maintenance charges to the housing society, maybe even that leaky faucet repair you called Doctor Sharma for. After deducting all that, you get your net rental yield. This is the real deal.

unnormalised: So, what's a "good" rental yield in India? It varies! In a high-demand area like Gurgaon, you might settle for 2-3%, hoping for capital appreciation later. In smaller cities or developing areas, you might find yields of 4-6%. Location, location, location, as they say! And the size of the flat matters too. Smaller 1 BHK units might offer better yields per sq ft than larger sprawling bungalows.

unnormalised: Remember, rental yields aren't everything. Capital appreciation (the increase in property value over time) is another crucial factor. Plus, consider the hassle factor – finding tenants, dealing with repairs, ensuring they don't turn your beautiful flat into a "Kachra Seth" movie set.
